decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive threats and disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board by efficiently removing opposing threats. Cards like Bloodtithe Harvester, Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger provide powerful threats while Thoughtseize, Duress, Fatal Push, and Go for the Throat help to disrupt your opponent's strategy. This deck is designed to close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and other powerful creatures while controlling the board with removal spells and counterspells. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast-paced aggression and card advantage through drawing cards and reusing spells from the graveyard. Utilizing cards like Treasure Cruise and Picklock Prankster, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with tempo plays and versatile threats like Brazen Borrower.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and countering their spells with cards like Spell Pierce. It also aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The creatures in the deck are evasive and provide aggressive pressure, with cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Moon-Circuit Hacker leading the charge. The deck also utilizes disruptive creatures like Spyglass Siren and Faerie Miscreant to disrupt opponents' strategies. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, disruptive, and aggressive.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful threats like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to control the board state and outvalue the opponent by leveraging its graveyard synergies with cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Blade of the Oni, while also generating card advantage with Castle Locthwain and Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes using low-cost spells like Artist's Talent and Consider. Using aggressive cards like Picklock Prankster and Cori-Steel Cutter to pressure the opponent while also generating card advantage with Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes removal spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to deal with threats. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient Arclight Phoenix strategy, while maintaining card advantage and controlling the board with various spells and creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells to deal damage and control the board. The strategy involves establishing board presence early with efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Sunspine Lynx, while using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to remove threats and deal direct damage. Cards like Reckless Rage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan provide additional removal options, while Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins offer additional sources of damage. The goal is to maintain pressure and close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently through the use of Lotus Field and various untap effects. It aims to tutor for key combo pieces using cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Dark Petition, eventually leading to casting powerful spells like Omniscience. It also includes control elements like Archdruid's Charm and Strict Proctor to protect the combo. The deck's strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces, ramping up mana, and utilizing powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and cantrips to quickly cycle through the deck in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. By consistently casting multiple spells in a turn, you can easily bring back multiple Phoenixes to pressure your opponent. The deck also includes removal and disruption cards to control the board while fueling your graveyard for the Phoenix recursion. The versatile mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and Phoenixes, while the inclusion of Treasure Cruise provides additional card advantage to keep the engine going.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the opponent's hand and board with disruptive cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while efficiently dealing with threats using removal spells like Go for the Throat and Fatal Push. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent by utilizing efficient creatures like Dark Confidant, Cecil, Dark Knight, Tinybones, the Pickpocket, and Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with Mox Amber and can generate card advantage with Tinybones. The land base includes utility lands like Takenuma, Abandoned Mire and Castle Locthwain, enabling consistent aggression on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control tools and disruption to manage the opponent's threats and gain an advantage. It includes cards that remove key threats, delay the opponent's game plan, and generate card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents. The deck also includes cards that generate tokens to apply pressure and gain life to stabilize. The mana base provides a good mix of white sources and utility lands to support the control strategy.
